column4: Question: apache2 error.log shows sendmail: not found .. when using php script.. sendmail works fine from the command line..
its define in php.ini as 'sendmail' ..
still cannot get php script to send email ..
any ideas?
i think theres a phpmail package, have you tried #php
i have a misty memory about it
ive never needed that so i wouldnt know
roundcube?
Yep, RoundCube for Webmail .. all emails going out shows up as localhost.mydomain.com.. if i send a client.. its fine..
that makes not sense.. OK .. if i use RoundCube webmail to send email, it shows up as me@localhost.mydoamin.com .. if i use a email client software, it shows up as me@mydomain.com
dude this thing looks awesome
it works.. well up until this morning.. the config fill looks fine..
so am i right in thinking it is an email client with a web based interface?
is that correct or am i readnig this wrong?
its Webmail Client.. it's basically PHP scripts that attach to your already existing mail server...
Its a cool software.. you need LAMP installed and the RoundCube php files..
im trying to run a headless pc and if i can access my locally stored mails via web page then sweet
Headless.. that sounds fun... PXE boot ?? yep.. i have a few here cause the workstations is dog old..
Question, if my PXE Boot machines started preforming like crap.. is it the local hardware or the host? thnx
possibly the lan
try pinging across to check latency
Its only 5 users on Gbit LAN Switches.. hmmm.. i think the term server needs a kick.. i'll do this later tonight..
sounds like it too
id still check the lan, just for completness
